articles.headline: Iran Threatens to Block Oil Shipments, as U.S. Prepares Sanctions
articles.snippet: The threat to cut off shipments through the Strait of Hormuz comes as President Obama prepares to sign legislation that could cut into Iran’s oil revenue.
articles.abstract: The threat to cut off shipments through the Strait of Hormuz comes as President Obama prepares to sign legislation that could cut into Iran’s oil revenue.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A senior Iranian official on Tuesday delivered a sharp threat in response to economic sanctions being readied by the United States, saying his country would retaliate against any crackdown by blocking all oil shipments through the Strait of Hormuz, a vital artery for transporting about one-fifth of the world’s oil supply.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Annie Lowrey

articles.headline: Slicing Costs, and Still Serving
articles.snippet: Kept open by bankrupt chains, zombie restaurants make just enough to cover basic costs, resulting in a glut of eateries chasing after scarce dining dollars.
articles.abstract: Kept open by bankrupt chains, zombie restaurants make just enough to cover basic costs, resulting in a glut of eateries chasing after scarce dining dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: You see them all across the country, in shopping malls and street corners, suburban towns and city centers: zombie restaurants.

articles.headline: Obama to Nominate Two for Vacancies on Fed Board
articles.snippet: President Obama will nominate a Harvard economist, Jeremy C. Stein, and a former private equity executive, Jerome H. Powell, to the Federal Reserve board of governors.
articles.abstract: President Obama will nominate a Harvard economist, Jeremy C. Stein, and a former private equity executive, Jerome H. Powell, to the Federal Reserve board of governors.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama said Tuesday that he would nominate Jeremy C. Stein, a Harvard economist, and Jerome H. Powell, a former private equity executive, to fill the two vacant seats on the Federal Reserve’s board.

articles.headline: The Retooled, Loose Romney, Guessing Voters’ Age and Ethnicity
articles.snippet: A close-up study of Mitt Romney captures a candidate who can be efficient, funny and self-deprecating, yet often strains to connect with voters in a personal way.
articles.abstract: A close-up study of Mitt Romney captures a candidate who can be efficient, funny and self-deprecating, yet often strains to connect with voters in a personal way.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAVENPORT, Iowa — When Mitt Romney introduces himself to voters, he has a peculiar habit of guessing their age or nationality, often incorrectly. (A regular query: “Are you French Canadian?”)
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker and Michael Barbaro

articles.headline: For Somali Women, Pain of Being a Spoil of War
articles.snippet: With the famine putting hundreds of thousands of women on the move, more rapes are being reported now in Somalia than at any time in recent memory.
articles.abstract: With the famine putting hundreds of thousands of women on the move, more rapes are being reported now in Somalia than at any time in recent memory.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOGADISHU, Somalia — The girl’s voice dropped to a hush as she remembered the bright, sunny afternoon when she stepped out of her hut and saw her best friend buried in the sand, up to her neck.

articles.headline: The High Cost of Failing Artificial Hips
articles.snippet: The widespread failure of all-metal hips may cost taxpayers, insurers and employers billions of dollars in the coming years.
articles.abstract: The widespread failure of all-metal hips may cost taxpayers, insurers and employers billions of dollars in the coming years.
articles.lead_paragraph: The most widespread medical implant failure in decades — involving thousands of all-metal artificial hips that need to be replaced prematurely — has entered the money phase.

articles.headline: Online Merchants Home In on Imbibing Consumers
articles.snippet: Shopping while drinking has long benefited high-end specialty retailers; now the popularity of Internet sales has opened alcohol-induced buying to the masses.
articles.abstract: Shopping while drinking has long benefited high-end specialty retailers; now the popularity of Internet sales has opened alcohol-induced buying to the masses.
articles.lead_paragraph: After enjoying a few drinks, some people go dancing. Others order food. And for some, it’s time to shop online.
